A world without plastic waste: If plastic could biodegrade as quickly as paper, the world would see a significant reduction in plastic waste. This would mean that plastic products would break down naturally and harmlessly, without polluting the environment. This would have a positive impact on marine life, as they would no longer ingest plastic debris or get entangled in it.

A new era of sustainable packaging: With plastic biodegrading quickly, companies would be incentivized to switch to sustainable packaging options, such as biodegradable plastics or paper-based alternatives. This would reduce the amount of plastic waste generated and help to protect the environment.

Reduced carbon footprint: As plastic biodegrades, it would no longer contribute to the carbon footprint of the products it is used in. This would result in a significant reduction in greenhouse gas emissions, helping to combat climate change.

Increased investment in sustainable technologies: With plastic biodegrading quickly, there would be a greater incentive for investment in sustainable technologies and innovations that could replace traditional plastics. This would lead to the development of new, eco-friendly products and materials.

Changes in consumer behavior: If plastic biodegraded quickly, consumers may be more likely to take greater care of their products and packaging, knowing that they would break down naturally. This could lead to a reduction in waste and a more mindful approach to consumption.
